description: Melanoma, an aggressive form of skin cancer that accounts for 75% of all skin-cancer-related deaths, is often detected later in people with darker skin complexions -- and the consequences can be devastating, a new study reveals.
title: Melanoma in darker skin tones

description: New research into molten rock 20km below the Earth's surface could help save lives by improving the prediction of volcanic activity.
title: Clues from deep magma reservoirs could improve volcanic eruption forecasts

description: Researchers have identified molecular and genetic pathways that direct the generation and maturation of parietal cells, the only cells in the body that produce acid, from stem cells. The findings can lead to new strategies to regulate parietal cell function in different diseases involving these cells, including autoimmune gastritis and stomach and esophageal cancers.
title: ERR-gamma 'trains' stomach stem cells to become acid-producing cells

description: Many artificial intelligence (AI) systems have already learned how to deceive humans, even systems that have been trained to be helpful and honest. Researchers describe the risks of deception by AI systems and call for governments to develop strong regulations to address this issue as soon as possible.
title: AI systems are already skilled at deceiving and manipulating humans

description: Mantis shrimp are small creatures known for their superlatives. Their eyes have 12 to 16 different color receptors, versus our own three, and can detect the polarization of light. Their punches are famously fast, accelerating on par with a 22-caliber bullet. They use these strikes on prey, predators and competitors alike.
title: Rolling with the punches: How mantis shrimp defend against high-speed strikes

description: Scientists reveal how ETV4 controls stem cell differentiation in response to mechanical cues.
title: Stem cells: A new mechanical transducer

description: Astronomers have proposed a new theory to explain the origin of phosphorus, one of the elements important for life on Earth. The theory suggests a type of stellar explosion known as ONe novae as a major source of phosphorus.
title: ONe novae stellar explosion may be source of our phosphorus

description: Employers are significantly more likely to offer job interviews and higher salaries to graduates with experience of artificial intelligence, according to new research.
title: AI knowledge gets your foot in the door

description: Many neurons exhibit 'mixed selectivity,' meaning they can integrate multiple inputs and participate in multiple computations. Mechanisms such as oscillations and neuromodulators recruit their participation and tune them to focus on the relevant information.
title: How the brain is flexible enough for a complex world (without being thrown into chaos)
